document_title: Mastitis: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Mastitis is an inflammation of the mammary tissue that is sometimes associated with infection. This inflammation causes the breasts to become swollen, hot, red and painful, and can sometimes cause fever and chills. [first]
Mastitis most commonly occurs in women who are breastfeeding (lactational mastitis), but can also occur in women who are not breastfeeding and in men.
Mastitis caused by breastfeeding can make you feel tired and exhausted, making it difficult to care for your baby. Sometimes mastitis causes the mother to wean her baby before planned. Continuing to breastfeed even while taking antibiotics for mastitis may be better for both mother and baby.
Mastitis is an inflammation of the mammary tissue that is sometimes associated with infection.
